
## Base R Plots

### Scatter Plot

```{r}
# Generate sample data
set.seed(123)
x <- rnorm(100)
y <- 2 * x + rnorm(100)

# Create scatter plot
plot(x, y,
     main = "Scatter Plot Example",
     xlab = "X Variable",
     ylab = "Y Variable",
     pch = 19,
     col = rgb(0.2, 0.4, 0.8, 0.6))
abline(lm(y ~ x), col = "red", lwd = 2)
```

### Histogram

```{r}
# Create histogram with normal distribution
data_hist <- rnorm(1000, mean = 100, sd = 15)
hist(data_hist,
     breaks = 30,
     col = "lightblue",
     main = "Histogram with Normal Distribution",
     xlab = "Value",
     probability = TRUE)
curve(dnorm(x, mean = 100, sd = 15),
      add = TRUE,
      col = "red",
      lwd = 2)
```

### Box Plot

```{r}
# Create grouped box plot
groups <- data.frame(
  Group_A = rnorm(50, mean = 10, sd = 2),
  Group_B = rnorm(50, mean = 15, sd = 3),
  Group_C = rnorm(50, mean = 12, sd = 2.5),
  Group_D = rnorm(50, mean = 18, sd = 4)
)

boxplot(groups,
        main = "Grouped Box Plot",
        ylab = "Values",
        col = c("lightblue", "lightgreen", "lightyellow", "lightpink"))
```

## ggplot2 Visualization

```{r}
library(ggplot2)

# Create sample dataset
sample_data <- data.frame(
  x = rep(1:10, 3),
  y = c(
    1:10 + rnorm(10, sd = 0.5),
    (1:10)^1.5 + rnorm(10, sd = 1),
    log(1:10) * 5 + rnorm(10, sd = 0.3)
  ),
  group = rep(c("Linear", "Power", "Logarithmic"), each = 10)
)

# Create ggplot
ggplot(sample_data, aes(x = x, y = y, color = group)) +
  geom_point(size = 3, alpha = 0.7) +
  geom_line(linewidth = 1) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "Multiple Trend Comparison",
    x = "X Axis",
    y = "Y Axis",
    color = "Trend Type"
  ) +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 14, face = "bold"),
    legend.position = "bottom"
  )
```
